data.text: My son, keep my words,
My son, honor the Lord, and thou shalt be strong;
Keep my commandments, and thou shalt live;
And bind them on thy fingers,
Say that wisdom is thy sister,
That she may keep thee from the strange and wicked woman,
For she looks from a window out of her house into the streets,
Passing by the corner in the passages near her house,
And speaking, in the dark of the evening,
When there happens to be the stillness of night and of darkness:
And the woman meets him having the appearance of a harlot,
And she is fickle, and debauched,
For at one time she wanders without,
Then she caught him, and kissed him,
I have a peace offering;
Therefore I came forth to meet thee, desiring thy face;
I have spread my bed with sheets,
I have sprinkled my couch with saffron,
Come, and let us enjoy love until the morning;
For my husband is not at home,
Having taken in his hand a bundle of money:
So with much converse she prevailed on him to go astray,
And he followed her, being gently led on,
And he hastens as a bird into a snare,
Now then, my son, hearken to me,
Let not thy heart turn aside to her ways:
For she has wounded and cast down many,
Her house is the way of hell,
